Package fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data

Interfaces for working with data sources made available by connectors.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAutoFillProvider
    Provides values for a specific target cell by querying a source cell, possibly subject to filters implied by restricting cells).
    ICell
    Defines a prototype for typed data field, such as a relational database column.
    ICellStructure
    Defines the basic API for a fixed or dynamic structure prototype that contains data cells.
    IData<T extends IType>
    Data for a specific cell in a specific item.
    IDataStructure
    Defines the basic API for a fixed or dynamic record prototype that contains data values.
    IEdge
    Defines an edge (a link between nodes that may have associated property values) in a graph database.
    IEdgeProperty<T extends IType>
    Property value for a graph database edge.
    IFetchable
    Defines the basic API for fetching data from a data source or a composite intersection.
    IIntersection
    An intersection of one or more data sources provided by a connector.
    IItem
    Provides access to a single data record provided by a data source obtained from a connector.
    IKey
    Defines a record key, usually (but not always) a single integer field.
    ILabelProvider
    Provides labels for data, optionally customized for a specific user.
    IList
    Provides access to records provided by a data source obtained from a connector.
    IListStructure
    Defines the basic API for creating filter criteria, sort criteria, and range criteria, as required when fetching lists of elements.
    IRelationship
    Defines an intersection relationship between a source cell and target cell.
    ISource
    A data source provided by a connector.
    IType
    Type of data that may be contained in a specific cell for a specific source.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Defer
    Categorizes data that may be excluded from initial "fetch" requests to optimize performance and network data transfer.
    Intersection
    Defines intersection types that can be applied to data sets.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    EdgeFetchException
    Thrown when an error occurs fetching data for an edge from a connector.
    ItemFetchException
    Thrown when an error occurs fetching data for an item from a connector.
    ItemStoreException
    Thrown when an error occurs storing data for an item from a connector.
    ListFetchException
    Thrown when an error occurs fetching data for a list from a connector.
    StructureException
    Thrown when an error occurs when attempting to add or remove dynamic elements to a data structure managed by a connector.

Package fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data Description

Interfaces for working with data sources made available by connectors.

Generally, the main connector will be an OpenAGE connector. Within the ViewShell application, OpenAGE concepts are represented as follows:

Transaction (and tables)
ISource
Field (and columns)
IItem
Next transaction
ISource.getDescendingSources()
Mosaic
ISource.getAscendingSources()
Lists (data for navigation screens)
IList, also using IRange, ISort, and IFilter.
Forms (data for view/edit screens)
IItem, also using IKey.

In addition, for other connector types, provision is made for the following concepts (useful for integration with data sources that can have loose schemas, such as "NoSQL" stores, document databases, XML files...):

Optional cells (columns that are defined, but not required)
ICellStructure.getOptionalCells(). Note that this is different from fixed cells, which are defined columns which can be mandatory or allow NULL values but are always returned.
Dynamic cells (additional columns that are defined per-record)
ICellStructure.hasDynamicCells() and IDataStructure.getExtraCells() Note that this is different from optional cells, as they do not need to be defined by the data source (defined per-record, possibly unique for a single record).

Note that cell structures define data structures. The actual data is most commonly made available via IDataStructure.getData(). Data values have types and are associated with cells.

Since:
1.0
